security: Disclosing informant names (CSNY 2623-S, CSNY 2822-S) and their contact information could compromise their safety and the FBI's intelligence-gathering capabilities. Revealing details of anti-CASTRO activities and sources of information could harm ongoing operations and international relations. For instance, the memo mentions 'anti-CASTRO activity in the NY area' and that 'NY sources familiar with anti-CASTRO activity...will make appropriate discreet inquiries through other sources of theirs in the anti-CASTRO field'.
summary: An FBI memorandum from August 9, 1963, details efforts by the New York office to identify Eduardo Perez Gonzalez and his potential connections to anti-Castro activities and the financing of raids on Cuba.
summary_one_paragraph: This FBI memorandum, sent from the SAC in New York to the Director of the FBI on August 9, 1963, concerns Eduardo Perez Gonzalez and his possible involvement in anti-Castro activities and the financing of raids on Cuba. In response to a Bureau letter, informants in the NY area familiar with anti-Castro movements were contacted but did not recognize the subject. One source mentioned Dan Chappel, a former gambler in Cuba, as a potential financier of raids, while NY files indicated that Eduardo Perez is associated with Alberto Bayo, a Cuban exile described as talkative, unpredictable, and undependable. The memo also notes that NY sources will continue to make discreet inquiries to determine the subject's identity.
